item.title: Ssh Root Login
item.description: Problem Attempting to log in as root over SSH fails with errors like: Connection closed by authenticating user root [preauth] pam_unix(sshd:auth): authentication failure Even after setting: PermitRootLogin yes Root Cause On Ubuntu, the root account is locked by default and password authentication is often disabled. Example status: sudo passwd -S root Output: root L YYYY-MM-DD 0 99999 7 -1 L = Locked account SSH password authentication cannot succeed without an unlocked root password Resolution Steps 1.
